items.abstract: Chimeric oligonucleotides containing stereoregular phosphorothioate and natural phosphodiester linkages have been obtained on the solid phase support using nucleoside oxathiaphospholanes and commercially available nucleoside phosphoramidites.
title: Synthesis of PS/PO-chimeric oligonucleotides using mixed oxathiaphospholane and phosphoramidite chemistry

reference.unstructured: 31P NMR spectra were recorded on Jeol JNM FX-60 (24.2 MHz) instruments. Negative values were assigned for compounds absorbing upfield from 85% H3PO4

The reaction of diastereomeric mixture of 2-chloro-2-oxo-4-methyl-1,3,2-dioxaphosphorinanes with sodium and benzanilide led to the mixture of products absorbing in31P NMR at -7.9 ppm,11.8 ppm,17.8 ppm, which proves that under applied spectroscopic conditions6diastereomers of4are indistinguishable

N-dialkylphosphorylN,N'-dialkyl(aryl)-ureas and -thioureas undergo base-catalyzed transformations into corresponding carbodiimides with concomitant formation of dialkyl phosphates or phosphorothioates, respectively (M. Mikolajczyk-personal communication)
